title: Variables
text: Represent the speeds using variables, the speed of riding bike as $$x+3$$, her walking speed as x

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the speed(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\frac{1}{4} \left(x+3\right)=\frac{1}{2} x$$

title: Substitution
text: Plug x into the original relationship find $$x+3$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 3 mph for walking and 6 mph for bike.
